result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ryan Scott Smarelli

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ryan Scott Smarelli not in court, in custody.  Attorney Bryan Joseph Cecil in court for Ryan Scott Smarelli.  Attorney Dennis Murphy in court on behalf of Patrick J Anderson for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Defendant's appearance is waived. Case in court for status conference. Defense is requesting adjourned status date to determine case posture. Court authorized the defendant to appear by zoom from Jefferson County Jail. Case adjourned to Branch 11.
Status conference scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Ryan Scott Smarelli in court with attorney Bryan Joseph Cecil.  Defendant Ryan Scott Smarelli in custody at Jefferson Correctional.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Ryan Scott Smarelli appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 11, Judge Swanson. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 11.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point DISCHARGE Report.  Received and filed.  nk
Justice Point Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed.

Defendant Ryan Scott Smarelli in court.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR IN PERSON.
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness is present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. State request the matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing or in the alternative status; denied. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Violation Report forwarded to Judge for review and filed.

Defendant Ryan Scott Smarelli in court, appear in person.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision Level 4.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Ryan Scott Smarelli in court with attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  Defendant Ryan Scott Smarelli in custody.  Paul Leonard Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ryan Scott Smarelli appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
